LabelText: Describe indicators of the suspected data breach (alerts, user reports, abnormal logs)
Identify affected data types (PII, PHI, credentials, financial data, source code)
Determine initial attack vector (phishing, vulnerable app, credential compromise)
Immediately contain affected systems to prevent further exfiltration
Preserve forensic evidence (logs, disk images, timestamps, network captures, memory snapshots)
Identify accounts used in the compromise and reset or revoke access
Determine scope of data exfiltration, including files, DB tables, or email contents
Notify internal leadership, legal, compliance, privacy officer, and IR team
Notify external parties as required (regulators, affected customers, law enforcement)
Patch vulnerabilities, rotate keys, and harden systems before restoring normal operations
Monitor for follow-up attacker activity or repeated intrusion attempts
Document full timeline, actions taken, evidence collected, and lessons learned
